result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Recklessly Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D Young

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim, Victim's residence or place of employment.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM - case called.  Defendant Nicholas D Young appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared in court, specially.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court question if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Smith - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Argument by State as to bond.  Statement by Atty Smith regarding bond.  Court sets bond.  Atty Smith waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am. Notice was faxed and emailed with the Bond
